title: Clotilde Essiane
text:
Clotilde Essiane aka Junior (born 6 August 1985) is a Cameroonian <a href="Boxing">boxer</a>, <a href="mixed%20martial%20arts">mixed martial artist</a> and a retired <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a>, who currently lives in Johannesburg, South Africa.
Football career.
Club career.
Essiane scored 17 goals for Cameroonian club TKC in 2004. In October 2006, she was registered as a player for Equatorial Guinean club Las Vegas.
International career.
Essiane was going to play for the <a href="Cameroon%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Cameroon national team</a> at the <a href="2004%20African%20Women%27s%20Championship">2004 African Women's Championship</a>, but she missed it due to a tear in her left thigh. Two years later, she was naturalized by <a href="Equatorial%20Guinea">Equatorial Guinea</a> to play for its <a href="Equatorial%20Guinea%20national%20football%20team">national team</a>.
International goals.
"Scores and results list Equatorial Guinea's goal tally first"
Mixed martial arts career.
In 2016, Essiane defeated Bunmi Ojewole from Nigeria and Rushda Mallick and Ansie Van Der Marwe, both from South Africa.
Boxing career.
Essiane represented Cameroon at the <a href="2018%20Commonwealth%20Games">2018 Commonwealth Games</a> and she was their flag bearer at the <a href="2018%20Commonwealth%20Games%20Parade%20of%20Nations">Parade of Nations</a> during the <a href="2018%20Commonwealth%20Games%20opening%20ceremony">opening ceremony</a>. She lost to Tammara Thibeault from Canada in the <a href="Boxing%20at%20the%202018%20Commonwealth%20Games%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%20middleweight">women's middleweight competition</a> quarterfinals.
